intro: Libanotis pyrenaica subsp. athamanthoides, commonly known as the Pyrenean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Pyrenees region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in open, sunny environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
